title: Healthy, herbal fair
text:
NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: KARNJANA KARNJANATAWE - + The government has turned Khlong Phadung Krung Kasem Market next to Government House into an outdoor fair for health and herbal products. 
Called "Muang Sukkhaphap Dee, Withi Chumchon", literally meaning healthy city and community lifestyle, the event has about 100 stalls offering herbal supplements, spa and beauty products, traditional medicines, local food, snacks and drinks, along with Thai traditional massage and spa services. 
According to the Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha, the event would further promote health and herbal products, which has market value more than 48 billion baht with an average growth of about 15% a year. 
The event is part of the government's rotating open-air fairs to promote local products from farmlands to people in the capital. It started with the floating market in February and event change every month. The latest two were the quality fruit and vegetable fair in May and the flower and ornamental plant and fish festival in June. 
The 20-day health and herbal fair will run until July 26. The fair is open from 10am to 6pm on Mondays to Thursdays and will open until 9pm on Fridays to Sundays. 
Visit www.facebook.com/khlongphadungkrungkasem . Cycling e-book launches 
The Tourism Authority of Thailand has launched new e-book to promote biking routes in nine provinces in the Central Region. 
According to TAT executive director Central Region Somchai Chompoonai, more people like touring around by their bicycles. TAT has forecast the number would increase 25% this year, up from 320,000 cyclists to 400,000 and will contribute up to 1.3 billion baht to the local tourism industry. 
With the new 76-page e-book, cyclists will be able to explore more routes in the Central Region. The routes include natural and historical places in Bangkok, especially in Thon Buri area, Samut Prakan, Samut Songkhram, Koh Kret in Nonthaburi, Pathum Thani, Chachoengsao, Lop Buri, Sing Buri and Nakhon Pathom. 
Each route has map and attractions with brief information and photos of each place. However, the guidebook is available only in Thai. 
The e-book can be accessed through issuu.com/tatcentralthailand/docs or downloaded without charge via Ookbee app available for users of iOS, Android and Windows 8. 
Call 1672 . Hotels update Pullman Khao Lak Katiliya Resort and Villas has turned its 500m² plot of land into a vegetable farm. 
It grows about 14 types of plants and the produce will be used in its five restaurants in this luxury beachfront resort. 
"We plant vegetables every month and maintain the average needs for the 500 to 600 guests that are in the resort daily," said the executive chef Patrice Guibert. 
As part of Accor Planet 21, a commitment to improve the local environment, the vegetable garden can also help reduce the resort's carbon footprint by decreasing the demand for motorised deliveries from Phuket International Airport to the hotel, he added. 
Visit www.pullmankhaolak.com . Escape Khao Yai Hotel has introduced a new family villa with a private heated pool. Called Grand Escape Two Bedroom Sunken Heated Pool Villa, the 263m² villa features two bedrooms, four bathrooms with rain showers, pantry, counter bar, dining room, living area and heated pool with daybeds. 
The 55-room hotel also has a 106m² function room, which can accommodate up to 90 people, spa, restaurant, roof top bar, fitness, swimming pool with pool bar and organic farm. Airlines update Scoot has launched two new routes, to Osaka in Japan and Kaohsiung in Taiwan. 
The airline uses Boeing 787 Dreamliners to depart from Singapore three times a week with a stopover in Bangkok before flying to Osaka, while the return leg will depart from Osaka with one stop in Kaohsiung to Singapore. 
The new service brings the total number of Scoot destinations to 15 in seven countries, according to airline CEO Campbell Wilson. 
He said the wide-bodied 787s offered more passenger space, improved humidity and air circulation. Also provided are in-flight internet and in-seat power socket. A total of 11 Dreamliners will be delivered to Scoot by March 2016. 
Visit www.flyscoot.com . Emirates will launch a flight to Mashhad in Iran from Sept 1. 
The city is the capital of Razavi Khorasan province in the northeast of the country. It is the second largest city and often attracts more than 2 million foreign visitors per year. Mashhad always hosts numerous international exhibitions and is the second most active exhibition centre after Tehran. 
"We look forward to boosting traffic in and out of Mashhad and drawing in visitors from a host of points across our global network including cities in Europe, India, Pakistan and the Gulf Co-operation Council, as well as Far East destinations like Bangkok," said Sheikh Majid Al Mualla, divisional senior vice-president for the carrier's commercial operations. 
Emirates will operate from Dubai to Mashhad with five weekly services utilising an Airbus A330-200 aircraft.
